arm_group.arm_group_label: tDCS simultaneously with hyperbaric oxygen therapy

brief_summary.textblock:
The treatment for patients with acute tinnitus consists of Methylprednisolone and hyperbaric
      oxygen therapy. For this study  transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) was added to
      the protocol. The purpose is to determine the effect of the time shift of tDCS. Two
      conditions will be compared: tDCS simultaneously with the hyperbaric oxygen therapy or tDCS
      3 weeks after the start of the tinnitus.

      An audiological testing will be performed at the day of admission, after 3 weeks, 6 weeks
      and 12 weeks.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Time Shift of Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) for Treatment of Acute Tinnitus

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age between 18 and 50 years

          -  presence of acute tinnitus or worsening of tinnitus caused by otogenic disease

          -  registration in UZA within 48 hours after start tinnitus

          -  VAS-score ≥ 4

          -  ability to understand and sign informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  history of epileptic seizures

          -  severe organic comorbidity

          -  psychiatric disorders or a history of psychiatric disorders with psychotic symptoms

          -  Pace maker

          -  pregnancy

arm_group_label: tDCS simultaneously with hyperbaric oxygen therapy

primary_outcome.description: Tinnitus Questionnaire, Visual Analog Scale, Beck Depression Index, Hyperacusis questionnaire

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Audiometry, Otoacoustic emissions, Tympanometry, Speech in noise

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Masking: Open Label
